3.1a.definition: a component in a computer system that processes data and instructions
an integrated circuit that is able to perform many of the functions of a CPU

3.1b.definition: the cycle through which data and instructions are processed
a type of computer architecture which introduced the concept of the stored program in the 1940s
usually a chip made from a semiconductor material which carries out the same tasks as a larger circuit made from individual components
a component in the CPU that stores the address of the next instruction to be processed
a component in the CPU that holds the address of the data or instruction to be located in RAM
wires used for the transmission of addresses between components in a computer
a component in the CPU that holds the data or instruction that are fetched from RAM
wires used for the transmission of data and instructions between components in a computer
a register that stores the current instruction being decoded and executed
the component in the CPU that controls all the operations in the CPU
produces timing signals on the control bus to ensure synchronisation takes place
memory that holds all data and programs needed to be accessed by the control unit
a temporary component in the CPU which can be general or specific in its use
a connection between major components in a computer that can carry data, addresses or control signals
can travel in one direction only; used to describe data
can travel in both directions; used to describe data
the component in the CPU that performs all the mathematical and logical operations required when processing data and instructions
a register that is built into the ALU that stores the result of any interim calculations
wires used for the transmission of control signals between components in a computer

3.1c.definition: the part of the CPU that contains all the components that are used to perform the fetch-decode-execute cycle
the number of fetch-decode-execute cycles that can be performed in a second
a type of storage that is built into the CPU, to store the most frequently used data and instructions
changing the clock speed of a system clock to a value higher than the factory/recommended setting
clock speeds are measured in terms of GHz; this is the vibrational frequency of the system clock which sends out pulses along the control bus

3.1d.definition: a set of commands that can be processed by a certain CPU
part of a machine code instruction that identifies what action the CPU has to perform
part of a machine code instruction that identifies what data is to be used

3.1e.definition: a computer system that performs a dedicated function
